name: Sylvetica
comment:
> [[ Broken Sky Online ]]
> [[ Previous Threads ]]
http://suptg.thisisnotatrueending.com/archive.html?tags=Broken%20Sky
> [[ Unique Identifier: Ascheritte ]]
http://pastebin.com/pZv3XUPQ
> [[ Twitter ]]
https://twitter.com/BrokenSkyOnline

> [[ BROKEN SKY ONLINE ]]

> [[ Conflict resolution is decided by the highest of three 1d100 rolls. ]]
> [[ Rolls of 1-3 or 98-100 will have enhanced effect. ]]
> [[ These two outcomes offset eachother when occuring simultaneously, yielding a normal outcome. ]]
> [[ A true critical failure occurs when a 1-3 is rolled, and all rolls are below the target number before modifiers. ]]
> [[ A true critical success occurs when a 98-100 is rolled, and all rolls are above the target number after modifiers. ]]
> [[ Critical successes will also occur if two rolls are within the critical success threshold, unless the third roll is within the critical failure threshold. ]]
> [[ However, the same will apply to critical failures.]]

> [[ Ascheritte's skills and passive abilities provide bonuses and modifiers to rolls. ]]
> [[ Modifiers and target numbers remain hidden currently, but a skill's degree of effect should be evident through its description. ]]
> [[ Active abilities can be used freely, but some are reactionary, and will be prompted during combat. ]]

name: Sylvetica
comment:
>>38429954

> [[ Underground: Vos's Lair // Neutral Territory // PVP Enabled ]]

“How many more of these things are down here?” You shout, the three of you rushing to make your way back through the cave to the ropes. There's skittering around you, and from the darkness, a jet of searing liquid splashes onto your ankle. You shout, stumbling backwards, then swing your sword as a shape jets forward.

> Ascheritte defeated sliverwing. [[ Party: Aelriss, Tatsumaki ]]
> [[ Level 6: You have 1 unspent EXP. ]]

“I don't know!” Aelriss shouts, ducking under another one of the shadowy figures. Eunoia's flapping around in a bit of a panic. Tatsumaki's already way behind you, struggling back onto the ropes you set.

The three of you make your way back up to the cave opening, a group of the giant sliverwings waiting far below you, watching your ascent.

“There's a boss down there.” You say, catching your breath.

“Probably more than one. I read about them while the message boards were still up.” Aelriss says. “They've apparently got a hive queen, but I hadn't heard anything about that... frog. What do we want to do now?”

> Write-in
> Back to Averron. Let's fill out our party and explore this place further.
> Back to Averron. Let's organize the trip to the Sanctum, and break for now.
> Back to Averron. You've got stuff to do around town.

comment:
>>38429968

“We should head back up.” You say, and the three of you begin towards the opening of the cave. “I'd like to get the trip to the Sanctum organized. Plan that out, and maybe take a break.”

“That sounds fine with me.” Aelriss says. “Thought about who else you want to come?”

“Well, there's Nel and Donnel...” You nod.

“Uh,” She looks at you. “I thought we were already going to invite them.”

“Right.” You respond.

“That's a full party, then?” She asks.

“Well, I was thinking we could maybe bring more than one party. We don't know how tough it's going to be in there, right?” You fold your arms. “Like, a raid.”

“Huh, interesting.” Aelriss says. “What makes you say that?”

“I'd like Ayla to be able to get down there to use the tech, but she's busy with her guild. Which is why I wanted to suggest a group expedition. We'd bring a second party of people from the Alliance guilds.” You respond.

“Sounds like a good idea. You're sure you're not just trying to get on Ayla's good side?” She pauses, then sticks her tongue out.

“Yeah, whatever.” You roll your eyes, waving her off. The three of you maneuver back up the bridges, and Averron City quickly comes into view.

Nel and Vision are offline.

Aelriss, Ayla, Donnel, Smith, and Tatsumaki are online.

[[ 1 ]]
> Ask Aelriss or Tatsumaki something. (Write-in)

> Look for an artificer that can make something from the insect heart.
> Visit the general store or blacksmith.
> Visit the fortune-teller's.
> Go to the guild district.
> Go to the tavern.

name: Anonymous
comment:
>>38431061
There's been some subtle nuances, I'd recommend reading it if you had the time.

Brief summary (because I'm too busy to give a full one right now) is that we're playing a virtual MMORPG that runs at an accelerated rate.

It features a special currency called celestial gems that are required for really fancy stuff.

If you die the first time you lose your 'ID' - special item that allows you to access your inventory. You then become a 'nameless' and the game is much more difficult for you. Of note is the fact you're unable to use celestial gems.

Nameless - ID'ers relations are tense because of this, there was a recent uprising incited by the dickbag PvP guild.

>>38430644

“The two of you have any other plans?” You ask.

“Not really.” Aelriss says, and Tatsumaki nods at her. “Not anymore.”

“Alright,” You respond. “Stay online for a bit and I'll let you know how things pan out.”

> [[ UI Messenger – Ayla ]]
> [[ Ascheritte ]]: Sup
> [[ Ayla ]]: (( Not much. ))
> [[ Ascheritte ]]: That was a quick response. Busy?
> [[ Ayla ]]: (( Having a chat with the Alliance leaders at the Guardians' hall. ))
> [[ Ayla ]]: (( Evidently there's been a bit of a controversy. I've a feeling changes are on the horizon. ))
> [[ Ascheritte ]]: Changes?
> [[ Ayla ]]: (( Don't worry about it. ))
> [[ Ayla ]]: (( You need something? ))
> [[ Ascheritte ]]: Remember the Sanctum thing? I wanted to talk to you about the possibility of a joint expedition.
> [[ Ascheritte ]]: Judging by what we found down there last time, this place seems important.
> [[ Ascheritte ]]: You said you wanted to bring one of your officers, right? I was thinking we could go in with two parties. You can bring a group of your guild members, or even others from the Alliance.
> [[ Ayla ]]: (( And you're bringing... an ambitious bunch of Guildless. ))
> [[ Ascheritte ]]: I mean.
> [[ Ayla ]]: (( :P Kidding. ))
> [[ Ayla ]]: (( I was already planning on taking a party of my own, to be honest. But it sounds like a good idea. I'll bring it up in a second. ))

You're idly meandering through the market square, and you've stalled near a player who's loitering by one of the stands, dressed like a witch with a tall red hat. You might have seen her doing crafting for people earlier, out of the corner of your eye.

“...Yes?” She says, as if you've intruded on her space. You -have- been here for a few seconds. “Speak your query, or be on your way.”

> “Sorry about that. Don't text and walk.”
> “That's no way to run a business. Can you do something with this bug heart?”

>>38431295

“That's no way to run a business.” You fold your arms, looking down a bit. Without the hat, she's about a full head shorter than you. “Nice hat, though.”

“...Thank you.” Her voice is oddly sultry, if a bit deadpan. “I apologize. I am an Artificer. Do you require my services?”

“Can you do anything with this bug heart?” You ask, producing the item from your UI.

“Mm. This is a Fire focus.” She giggles. “Pulsing, burning within. Give?”

“Just for a second.” You say, handing it over.

> [[ UI Messenger – Ayla ]]
> [[ Ascheritte ]]: So, controversy?
> [[ Ayla ]]: (( Someone's accused Liza of shenanigans. I can't say what, but a few people are at each others' throats and we're trying to get it cleared up. ))
> [[ Ayla ]]: (( And she's definitely going to get upset if I keep messaging during the meeting. ))
> [[ Ascheritte ]]: Alright.
> [[ Ascheritte ]]: Wait, what do you mean you were planning on taking a party of your own?
> [[ Ascheritte ]]: You were going to invite me, right?
> [[ Ayla ]]: (( Ashe, I'm sort of a guild leader. Other people expect things of me. ))
> [[ Ayla ]]: (( I'm sorry, but I wouldn't take offense if I were you. ))
> [[ Ayla ]]: (( Oh God, she's looking at me. One sec. ))

“Yes.” The witch responds. “If you'd like, I can augment your weapon with fire.”

“Is that all?” You ask. “What does it do?”

“Your attacks will deal additional damage, especially so to those who fear the flames.” She nods. “Each focus is aligned to a specific element, though more powerful foci might bring their own unique abilities. Once it is done, however, it cannot be removed without destroying your weapon.”

> Write-in

comment:
>>38431988

> [[ UI Messenger – Ayla ]]
> [[ Ascheritte ]]: How were you going to get in?

There's no answer. Is she still busy?

“That's fine with me.” You respond, checking your inventory. “Oh, hell, this is going to cost money, right?”

“Mmm...” She shakes her head, thinking briefly before extending her hands to accept your blade. “No, first one is free.”

You watch; the witch runs her hand from the steel blade's base to the point, the still-beating heart in her hand dissolving into red dust that flows into the metal, heating it white-hot, giggling dementedly from deep in her throat for the duration of the entire process. A few heads turn in the market square as red light creeps across the ground between the stands, then stops at once as she brandishes the weapon and hands it to you, hilt-first.

“I hope this is satisfactory.” She responds.

You spend 1 EXP and learn Concussive Strike.

> [[ Offensive Mastery 3 offers a choice from: ]]
* Critical Threat // Passive // Slightly increases critical strike range. Required for: "Fleshrend", "Unarmed Fighter".
* Two-handed Mastery // Passive // Increases the effectiveness of two-handed weapons, which become lighter and more balanced in your hands. Required for: "Titan's Strength".
* Dual Wield Mastery // Passive // Increases the chance to hit with a weapon wielded in the off-hand. Required for "Cross Strike", "Titan's Grip".
* Whirlwind Attack // Active // Spend PP to make a barreling attack that deals damage to all targets in your weapon's reach.
* Overpower // Active // After an opponent dodges, spend PP to break their guard with an attack of increased speed and effectiveness. Required for “Combat Expertise”.
* Charge // Active // Spend PP to charge toward a target opponent, attempting to push through or navigate all obstacles between the two of you. Required for “Duel”, “Instantaneous Movement”.

What will you do?

> Write-in

comment:
>>38433455
>>38433554
Oh, I glanced over the "get retaliate instead" votes. N would have won if I'd interpreted those as Ns, but there's not really a great way to use "anti-votes" toward a constructive purpose in this case. It shouldn't really matter a whole lot unless there's massive outcry for some reason.

Making your way to the center of the city, you approach the Materialization Altar, again beholding that girl, eyes fixed forever on the cave ceiling, the sky above. The city square looks like there was a fight here recently. It's quieter than it has been, and most of the players in the area seem to be keeping to themselves.

You make your way up the platforms that rise up from the fountain water.

> [[ Greater Celestial Materialization Altar ]]
> Celestial Manifestation “Averron City”
> MANIFESTATION GRANTED BY:
Andor, Liza, and Ayla, “that these newborn souls might have an origin point from which to forge their destiny”
> [[ Offer Celestial Gems ]]
* Create Celestial Artifact
* Enhance Celestial Artifact
* Empower Mundane Item
* Enhance Celestial Manifestation
* Destroy Celestial Manifestation
> [[ Offer Item ]]
* Offer an Item to the Celestials

You offer Kazamari's Unique Identifier, and watch as it dissolves into glowing motes that drift skyward to illuminate stalactites high above.

> Go wait at the Guardians' guild hall.
> Do something else at the Materialization Altar. (Write-in)
> Head to the fortune teller.
> Head to the tavern.
> Head to the blacksmith.

> [[ Crimson Guardians – Guild Hall ]]
> [[ Guild Leader: Liza ]]
> [[ Guild Officers: Kainzo, Mendicant, Florica ]]
> [[ “ Glory Is Forever ” ]]

You contemplate knocking.

You remember this place; lovely, somewhere between barracks and castle, with a red roof and numerous flags emblazoned with the crimson insignia. The district is quiet, so you elect to wait outside, watching the hall from a nearby alley It's at least a few minutes before anything happens: then, you see the doors open, and a crowd of people emerges. You recognize Andor, from the Disposable Heroes, mid-debate with a hooded woman who walks at his side. Behind, there's the Writ Keepers' officers; you see Ayla, Dorian, and another man, a pair of legionnaires from the Crimson Guardians bringing up the rear to escort them out.

What will you do?
> Write-in

“Ayla?” You ask, approaching the crowd. You look around, but don't see Liza; she must still be inside.

“Ah, Ascheritte?” Ayla says, looking surprised. Dorian raises an eyebrow at you; it's been a while since you've seen him. “I didn't expect to see you here... I was actually just about to return your message.”

“Hm, this is the one you've been taking about, Ayla?” Dorian asks.

“Yes,” She responds. “Why do you ask?”

“I remember him from earlier.” Dorian responds. “You caught him off guard, but he seemed... slow, regardless.”

“I was a bit out of my element.” You glare at the robed man. “Ayla, can we talk in private?”

“What's this, then?” He sneers.

Ayla sighs. “Ascheritte, don't pay him any attention. Anything you can tell me is good with him. What's up?”

name: Sylvetica
comment:
“I wanted to talk about the expedition.” You respond. “Did you get the chance to bring it up?”

“Barely, though my audience was a bit petulant at the time.” She responds. “The Guardians are supposedly prepared whenever we'd like to begin, though they insist upon leading our team.”

“Despite this, Ayla and I will obviously be attending.” Dorian adds. “Tell me, Ascheritte, when did you plan on orchestrating this expedition?”

“Tonight.” You respond. “Well, in a few hours, I mean. We're waiting on a couple of people, and my members and I want a break beforehand.”

“Tonight? Are you daft?” Dorian asks. “We've barely had the time to—“

“That sounds fine.” Ayla interrupts. “Ascheritte, I'd like to apologize for...”

“It's fine. I just wanted you to reconsider organizing your own party to make your way to the Sanctum, after what we'd been through.” You shake your head, and Dorian winces at you. “I visited the fortune-teller about what we found in Velika's tomb, and earned some information that seems indispensable to the cause, about Kjorikos and his work.”

“I didn't have intent to abandon you, Ascheritte. As the leader of a guild, I've my own set of responsibilities.” A group of individuals passing in the direction of the Writ Keepers' hall hail her, and she waves in kind. “To them, and others—and as one of the leaders of the Averron Alliance, I maintain a measure of responsibility for all those who pass through this city.”

“Ayla, this is awfully undignif—“

“Dorian.” The Alliance leader hisses, taking a step towards him that causes him to shrink back on one foot, eyes widened. “How long do you expect to remain my officer at this rate?”

“I—I'm sorry.” He waves his hands dismissingly, tone growing nervous.

There's a pause, and Ayla turns to face you. “Ascheritte, would you mind sharing a word with me in our guild hall?”

name: Sylvetica
comment:
>>38435325

“I understand.” Dorian nods, then begins down the street, glancing over his shoulder periodically.

“This way.” Ayla motions toward you, leading you towards one of the nearby guild buildings. The architecture echoes faintly of a town hall or library, rather than a military building, and there's a strange change in atmosphere as she leads you through the front door.

> [[ Guild Hall: Writ Keepers // Writ Keepers' Territory // PVP Disabled ]]

The interior is well-furnished, with the main room looking something like a large study. There's what looks like a small alchemy lab set up on a table in an alcove on one end of the room, with a shelf housing numerous exotic-looking potted plants and glassware. A large table and chairs in the center of the room, where a number of Ayla's guild members appear to be mid-discussion; many of the other walls are lined with bookshelves.

“Ayla!” A lively-looking man laughs, turning from the table, with a walking stick balanced across his lap. “The lot of us are on the brink of discovery, we are! Care to join us?”

“Sincerest apologies, Cardus.” Ayla responds. “I'd be glad to later, but as of now, I've a guest. Please welcome Ascheritte, however; he's a personal friend.”

“Heyo!” A lithe woman with dark skin and swept-back blonde hair waves, before returning to carefully-inspecting her blades. “Name's Sulya. I'm loving the armor, there!”

“Huh?” You look down at your chest, only now remembering the weight around your shoulders. “Ah, thank you. It took some work to get.”

“I'll bet it was well worth it.” Sulya responds. “Alright, then: sorry to keep you.”

“It's no big deal.” You say, and she smiles as you wave her off. “Take care.”

> [[ Continued ]]

name: Sylvetica
comment:
>>38435918

Ayla's workshop is downstairs—and it's more organized than Smith's. There's assorted bits of technology scattered about, but larger than you're used to seeing: conical drill bits standing about half your height, and large consoles that look vaguely reminiscent of the message board server, albeit incomplete. On a table in the middle, you see a scattered variety of tools, fractalline crystals, and explosives assemblies.

“Alright, sorry about the mess.” Her tone changes, voice a bit less airy. “And about Dorian. Now, what did you really want to talk about?”

>>38436356

“The Sanctum, and Kjorikos, like I said.” You smile. “But also, about Freakshow and their leader.”

“Anaximander.” Ayla says. “You know him?”

“I'm surprised anyone does.” You respond. “He seems like an elusive one. My party and I had a brief skirmish with him in the city, before the riots were over.”

“What? I don't believe it.” She folds her arms. “What happened?”

“He's powerful. Armed to the teeth with weapons and spells, and a katana that causes some sort of stunning effect on contact.” You respond. “In addition, he's wielding a Celestial Artifact that allows him to teleport at will.”

“Liza informed us. It's troubling. Do you know how far he can reach?” She asks.

“Far.” You respond. “I'm not sure what the limit is, or if he even has one. My party and I have been concerned, as he appears to be using it to orchestrate ambush groups.”

“We discussed the possibility.” Ayla responds. “The Guardians are fixated on driving Freakshow out of Averron, but we've elected not to move until we've reached a consensus. I'm trying to push for neutrality, but given I've been a part of more than one of their attacks now, I'm inclined to join the cause.”

“I don't think I'm in a position to arbitrate.” You nod.

“Right, then. What about Kjorikos?” She asks. “This, I want to hear.”

“He was the first Artificer, or some such. Condemned for supposedly heretical practices—something about pioneering 'aerheric' stuff?” A chill runs down your spine as you remember the fortune-teller's words.

“Aetheric...” Ayla says. “That's a word I want to hear right now. Go on.”

> [[ Continued ]]

name: Sylvetica
comment:
>>38437126

“Regardless, Velika was the woman he loved...” You continue.

“But she died, and we and a bunch of other raiders ransacked her tomb.” Ayla says.

“Which he built his Sanctum over. Got it in one.” You say. “I think I might be cursed. The fortune-teller said that if we don't do something about Kjorikos soon, something bad is going to happen.”

“Think that's true?” Ayla asks.

“I don't know. I'm not sure what to think.” You respond.

“This game has a way of making you feel crazy.” Ayla says. “As far as the expedition, I'll begin making arrangements as soon as possible. I'd like to break for a bit as well. What time is it where you are?”

“Uh, shit.” You pause, mulling over time—you now notice that this game has no internal clock. You wanted to attend that club meeting tonight, just to see if there are any other BSO players in the vicinity. “I think I started playing again at like, 3:30 in the afternoon. I had something I wanted to do tonight, but I can pass it up as long as I get food and rest somewhere in there.”

“Assuming I haven't lost track of time completely, it sounds like you're an hour ahead of me?” She responds. “How does 8 or 9 your-time sound? It'll give us plenty of space to get whatever we need done in-game and out.”

“I'm alright with that.”

“You'll be leading your group of five, I assume?” Ayla asks.

“Nel is our leader.” You think about it for a second. “But, yeah, I'm in charge.”

“Have you met Liza or any of the Guardians yet?” She asks. “It would probably be prudent of you to stop by her hall and introduce yourself at some point—this means you're going to be a raid leader alongside whoever she selects to join the team.”

> Write-in

name: Sylvetica

“Anything you can tell me about the meeting?” You ask. “And what was up with Liza?”

“We've agreed not to disclose most of the major goings-on. Some false allegations were made by a few members of Disposable Heroes, suggesting she was acting to exacerbate the rioting in Averron.” Ayla responds. “It sounds ridiculous, really, given all of us—Liza included—were doing the best we could given incomplete information. Until she gave her verdict, I wasn't even aware that the leader of Freakshow was involved.”

“Right. So, what did you think I wanted to talk about?”

“I don't know.” She pouts. “I thought you knew something that you couldn't say in public, the way you were acting earlier.”

“Nope.” You shake your head. “Just the expedition and current events. Ah, were you still interested in having me join the Writ Keepers?”

“Mm,” She grits her teeth, turning away from you. “Don't tell anyone about this, okay?”

“Alright.”

> [[ Continued ]]

name: Sylvetica
comment:
>>38438249

“Some of the guild officers are currently weighing the possibility of a complete merger between the Alliance guilds.”

“You'd all be one guild, then?” You raise an eyebrow.

“And the new Averron Alliance would take full control of Averron City.”

“Aren't the Writ Keepers a roleplaying guild? And the Disposable Heroes are super-casual, I thought.” You ask. “How is that going to work?”

“It's not, which is why I'm against it—though it might be the best thing to do on behalf of the rest of the players, given my role in the hierarchy.” Ayla frowns. “My guild would likely lose almost all of its membership. Likewise, the metaphorical fat would be trimmed from Disposable Heroes. The ideologies of the individual guilds would have to be done away with to benefit the group.”

“What about the Guardians?”

She pauses, continuing with a sigh. “The merger would leave us a council, of the players that are either the strongest or the most fit to lead.”

The conversation stalls.

“It's just talk,” Ayla says. “So don't go telling all of your friends, alright? I mean it.”

You nod.
